title: Point 1
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Declares class header: class TrashCan

Canonical Solution: 

public class TrashCan
{
    private double capacity;
    private double trashAmount;
    
    public TrashCan(double weightCapacity)
    {
      capacity = weightCapacity;
      trashAmount = 0.0;
    }
    
    public double acceptTrash(double dumpWeight)
    {   
      if (trashAmount + dumpWeight >= capacity)
      {
          trashAmount += dumpWeight - capacity;
      } 
      else
      {
          trashAmount += dumpWeight;
      }
      return capacity – trashAmount;              
    }      
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • declare the class as private
  • include extraneous code outside the class
  • Include () with or without parameters in the class header

The response earns the point.

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • declare the class as private
  • include extraneous code outside the class
  • Include () with or without parameters in the class header

title: Point 2
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Declares private instance variables that can be used to determine the trash weight and capacity of the trash can

Canonical Solution: 

public class TrashCan
{
    private double capacity;
    private double trashAmount;
    
    public TrashCan(double weightCapacity)
    {
       capacity = weightCapacity;
       trashAmount = 0.0;
    }
    
    public double acceptTrash(double dumpWeight)
    {   
      if (trashAmount + dumpWeight >= capacity)
      {
          trashAmount += dumpWeight - capacity;
      } 
      else
      {
          trashAmount += dumpWeight;
      }
      return capacity – trashAmount;              
   }      
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point if they

  • incorrectly initialize the instance variables

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • declare any instance variable static
  • omit private in instance variable declaration
  • declare a variable outside the class
  • declare an instance variable inside the constructor

The response earns the point.

Responses can still earn the point if they

  • incorrectly initialize the instance variables

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • declare any instance variable static
  • omit private in instance variable declaration
  • declare a variable outside the class
  • declare an instance variable inside the constructor

title: Point 4
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Assigns correct initial values to capacity instance variable

Canonical Solution: 

public class TrashCan
{
    private double capacity;

descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point if they

  • write a class header with parameter and assign the parameter to the instance variable

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • fail to declare or initialize instance variable for capacity
  • assign a value to instance variables from an unknown source
  • assign initial value to local variable instead of instance variable, even if the local variable is declared as private

The response earns the point.

Responses can still earn the point if they

  • write a class header with parameter and assign the parameter to the instance variable

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • fail to declare or initialize instance variable for capacity
  • assign a value to instance variables from an unknown source

title: Point 6
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Correctly calculates and updates variable used to maintain amount of trash (or space remaining) in the trash can, including emptying when appropriate (algorithm)

Canonical Solution: 

public class TrashCan
{
    private double capacity;
    private double trashAmount;
    
    public TrashCan(double weightCapacity)
    {
       capacity = weightCapacity;
       trashAmount = 0.0;
    }
    
    public double acceptTrash(double dumpWeight)
    {   
      if (trashAmount + dumpWeight >= capacity)
      {
          trashAmount += dumpWeight - capacity;
      } 
      else
      {
          trashAmount += dumpWeight;
      }
      return capacity – trashAmount;              
   }      
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point if they

  • fail to return the correct amount
  • use a variable declared outside the method as an instance variable when instance variables do not exist
  • declare instance variables outside the class, or in the class within a method or constructor

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • fail to update the instance variable(s)
  • calculate the correct remaining capacity but return something else

The response earns the point.

Responses can still earn the point if they

  • fail to return the correct amount
  • use a variable declared outside the method as an instance variable when instance variables do not exist
  • declare instance variables outside the class, or in the class within a method or constructor

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • fail to update the instance variable(s)
  • calculate the correct remaining capacity but return something else
